result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie Y Kluge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs in the amount of $93.00 to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melanie Y Kluge

records.addlTxt: 15CM-477 and 16CM-53 and 16TR-321 - All Cases Called @ 12:15 PM: Defendant Melanie Y Kluge in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Def and counsel acknowledge receipt of Amended Complaint as to 15CM-477 - Reading Waived.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-477 - Plea:  NC  16CM-53 - Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismissed Dom Abuse Enh.  Ct 2 of 15CM-477 and Ct 2 of 16CM-53 Both DRI.  No Statement offered by Def. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  16CM-53:  2 days WCJ w/TS credit of 2 days with Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Bond of $200 to be applied to Court Costs.  Appeal Rights Given.  16TR-321 DRI.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:55 p.m. Defendant Melanie Y Kluge in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant requesting court appointed counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. NGP entered. Court orders $350 Cash Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
